title: HAML rendered view js caching
body:
Since you have added the caching now, I thought I'd officially request this.
As I have shown in my fork, this greatly increases performance to at least the speed of ejs, if not better. I'd be glad to implement it, if you want me to. (will re-fork and use new caching)

title: Abstract caching
body:
add promise to static file etc so that the cache plugin can
provide its own caching arbitrarily, and also its own setting defaults

title: Cache store setting
body:
```
set('cache store', new cache.Store.Memory)
```

we need to default this as well

title: Add Cache plugin docs to wiki
Implement static file caching
body: using new cache api, benchmarks..

title: Add default "production" env configurations
body: with "cache view contents" enabled etc

title: Implement view caching
body: and add 'cache views' setting

title: Cache expiration support
body:
```
cache.set('foo', 'bar', { lifetime: (5).days })
```

we would need a little worker to reap() as well

title: Problem with examples.
body:
I'm running the example app.js, and to even get it started I had to copy the contents of express/lib into my /usr/local/lib/node/libraries folder.

Then it started fine, but nothing displayed at http://localhost:3000/chat. I looked at the source, and it seems the `<script>` tags don't close properly. I deleted "script" from the self_close_tags array in haml, but the problem persisted.

Then I tried the example in the readme, and got the following error: `ReferenceError: Redirect is not defined`

using:
node v0.1.24-32-g39ca935
express v0.0.2

title: Can't make
body:
I copy-pasted the install command, and got this error:

Error: Cannot find module 'querystring'
    at node.js:813:31
    at findModulePath (node.js:744:5)
    at node.js:766:7
    at node.js:775:7
    at [object Object].<anonymous> (node.js:712:32)
    at [object Object].emitError (node.js:266:13)
    at node.js:505:27
    at [object Object].wait (node.js:324:11)
    at require (node.js:895:32)
    at Object.<anonymous> (lib/express/request.js:10:19)
make: **\* [app] Error 1

I downloaded 0.0.1 instead, and got a different error from `make app`:
Error: Cannot find module 'support/js-oo/lib/oo'
    at node.js:813:31
    at findModulePath (node.js:744:5)
    at node.js:766:7
    at node.js:775:7
    at [object Object].<anonymous> (node.js:712:32)
    at [object Object].emitError (node.js:266:13)
    at node.js:505:27
    at [object Object].wait (node.js:324:11)
    at require (node.js:895:32)
    at Object.<anonymous> (lib/express.js:2:1)
make: **\* [app] Error 1

title: Cache API
body: With simple memory Store for now, add store/memory.js and cache.js

title: Remove extname(), dirname(), basename()
body: Use path module and adjust express as needed

title: Fix Request#param() query string support
body: The spec is failing, possibly due to a mock issue but check things out

title: "make test" should say I need to install scons, or get it for me
body:
When I ran

```
make test
```

it didn't work until I installed scons,
http://www.scons.org/

title: Change uri -> url to match latest node changes
body:
Node appears to have also removed uri.params etc

TypeError: Cannot read property 'path' of undefined
    at IncomingMessage.init (lib/express/request.js:65:51)
    at IncomingMessage.Class (lib/support/js-oo/lib/oo.js:61:19)
    at [object Object].route (lib/express/core.js:233:15)
    at IncomingMessage.<anonymous> (lib/express/core.js:218:58)
    at ServerSideConnection.<anonymous> (/usr/local/lib/node/libraries/http.js:338:14)
    at node.js:979:1
    at node.js:983:1

title: Add collection support for the pure-js xml library
body: Since some people will prefer this although its slow

title: Utilize the new hurtin query string lib in node
body: and refactor it.. because its gross

title: Response length issue
body:
Slowing of response and browser loading indicator is still continually displaying. 
Previously some of this was due to invalid body lengths

title: Fix spec segfault issue
body:
Specs are now causing segfaults seemingly at random or 
due to larger files. Find the bug in node or find a way to get around this.

title: Alternate layouts
body: with the given layout name

title: Remove base64
body: Not used at the moment, moved to ext.js

title: Accepts should allow multiple args
body:
```
this.accepts('png', 'jpeg')
```

title: Add attachment specs
body:
Previously causing a segfault due to the spec being to large?? not sure..

```
    describe '#attachment()'
  it 'should set Content-Disposition to attachment'
    get('/report', function(){
      attachment()
      return 'foo'
    })
    get('/report').headers['content-disposition'].should.eql 'attachment'
  end

  it 'should set attachment filename'
    get('/report', function(){
      attachment('report.pdf')
      return 'foo'
    })
    get('/report').headers['content-disposition'].should.eql 'attachment; filename="report.pdf"'
  end
end
```

title: Better exception handling
body: via 'uncaughtException'

title: hang on missing view
Hanging request
body:
When I open up the chat example (or a static html sendfile example of mine) Opera 10.10 loads it and all is fine, except it still shows the loading progress bar and the loading cursor.

I have no idea how this could happen and it very well might be a bug in Opera. But maybe you know what's wrong. :)

title: this.header('accept') sometimes not a string
body:
Sometimes I get this error:

lib/express/express/request.js:158
    return this.header('accept').indexOf(mime(path)) != -1
                                 ^
TypeError: Cannot call method 'indexOf' of undefined
    at IncomingMessage.accepts (lib/express/express/request.js:158:34)
    at [object Object].route (lib/express/express/core.js:242:19)
    at IncomingMessage.<anonymous> (lib/express/express/core.js:218:58)
    at ServerSideConnection.<anonymous> (/usr/local/lib/node/libraries/http.js:371:14)
    at node.js:966:1
    at node.js:970:1

What can I do to (help) fix this?

title: Match node's server.listen() params with run()
body: Same ordering and add backlog

title: Change __method__ to _method
body: To comply with Racks idiom, this way my jquery-rest plugin will still work etc..

title: file path security
body: abstract routine(s) to validate accessible file paths, disallow .. and equivalents

title: File upload helper
body: with progress support :D

title: Meaningful toString() on all classes / instances
Better query string parser
body: Implement solid highly tested recursive query string parser

title: Promo like crazy
body: Lets make Express the defacto framework for node.js :D

title: Support chunked responses
body: trigger response at a different point?

title: Request#respond() should accept an object with #forEach()
body: To build up body contents

title: Redirect helper status arg but default to 303
Better accepts() support
body: follow specifications not just quick substring match

title: Move "application/x-www-form-urlencoded" support to a BodyDecoder plugin or similar
body: As to abstract from Request, however Express should use this (and others) by default

title: Allow plugins to conditionally supply routes
body: When finished Static should probably be a plugin, with some default routes

title: View should be a Plugin
body:
When js-oo supports extending a class then
we should setup settings and helpers only once
 use(View) etc is called

title: Implement environment support
body: Check EXPRESS_ENV environment variable then default to development

title: Better naming for various get / post / route param properties
body: request.params.{get, post, path} etc

title: First class Cookie object
body: and better cookie handling and cookie clearing

title: Parse inline-comments for site
body: Normalize / add more documentation inline

title: Issue / bug with Node's process.mixin() function
body:
Due to how the deep copy is handled, seems to be messing up the 
prototype of some of Express` classes. Double check that Request is fine,
MockRequest is seeing some issues. Perhaps resort to a new deep copy utility

title: Everything should be request specific
body:
After body is complete, break of an instance of Request
- Refactor helper specs
- Refactor plugin specs
- Add route evaluation context specs
- Fix docs

title: Splat support
500 page should show stack contents
body: When clicked stack line / context contents should be shown for reference

title: Have default settings for 'test', 'development', and 'production'
body: In core. 'test' should throw exceptions, 'development' should enable 'helpful 404' etc

title: Display 404 when in development environment with route example
body: Examples just like sinatra

title: mime() and friends should accept literal 'foo/bar' syntax
Conditional Collection support with libxmljs
body: When available

title: Use get(), put(), etc as REST clients when :// is present
View opcode cache
body:
Cache intermediate code that a template engine may compile, to 
prevent IO each time.

title: Pass params as function args
Interactive shell
body: via repl or similar

title: Add flash message support
body: once sessions are supported

title: Command-line utility
body: With templates etc

title: set environment based on ENV
body: Look into how nodejs exposes this

title: Add Session support
body: Should be extendable via subclass of Session to store in an alternate storage mechanism

title: Add redirect() helper
body:
Make plugin, anything that can be a plugin should be

```
redirect('http://vision-media.ca')
redirect(back)  // referrer 
redirect(home) // '/' or set('basepath') || set('home')
```

title: Template engine mapping API
Re-write mustache.js
body: The original author's version is really slow

title: View specs
body: We need async support, or to mock the async functionality. Also we could add a **wait** option to render()

title: View caching mechanism
body:
only cache in production env,
make sure that contrib view engines have options
to disable their own caching

title: Profiling for views etc
body:
Add some rendering hooks, only really needed
once we have ORM support so we can see what
is impacting performance

title: /user/1/foo should not match /user/:id?
body: param('id') becomes '1/foo'

title: Reverse plugin stack for response event
body: So Profiler can wrap leading / trailing triggers etc

title: Log to stderr
body: with common logger and profiler

title: Plugin options
body:
```
use(MethodOverride, { param: '_method' })
```

title: Speed up CommonLogger
body: cuts rps down by 1/3, date formatting == slow

title: Remove route eval()
Environment mode support
body: and options like sinatra supports for raising errors, etc

title: Output errors when error() handler is not defined
